name: Genmo
description: Genmo is a frontier AI lab offering open-source video generation models to create high-quality videos from text prompts.
longDescription: Genmo is an AI research lab focused on developing cutting-edge, open-source video generation models, such as Mochi 1, to democratize AI-driven video creation. Its mission is to unlock the creative potential of artificial intelligence, enabling users to produce realistic, high-fidelity videos from simple text descriptions. The platform caters to creators, developers, and researchers by providing tools to generate videos for entertainment, marketing, education, and more. By releasing models under the Apache 2.0 license, Genmo fosters community collaboration and innovation in AI video technology. The hosted playground at genmo.ai/play allows users to experiment with video generation for free, while developers can access model weights on GitHub and Hugging Face for customization. Genmo aims to bridge the gap between AI-generated videos and real-world motion quality, with applications extending to robotics and embodied AI.
features: Text-to-video generation creates high-quality videos from detailed text prompts, enabling effortless content creation.
Mochi 1, a 10-billion-parameter model, produces realistic videos with smooth motion at 30 frames per second.
Open-source accessibility under the Apache 2.0 license allows developers to modify and integrate the model for custom applications.
High-fidelity motion ensures videos adhere to physical laws, delivering lifelike animations and transitions.
The hosted playground at genmo.ai/play enables users to experiment with video generation without installation.
Asymmetric Diffusion Transformer (AsymmDiT) architecture enhances prompt adherence for precise video outputs.
Batch mode allows users to generate multiple videos from a single prompt, streamlining creative workflows.
Community-driven improvements support frequent updates and tailored functionalities through open-source collaboration.

faqs.question: What is Genmo AI?
faqs.answer: Genmo AI is a research lab developing open-source video generation models like Mochi 1, which create high-quality videos from text prompts for creators and developers.

faqs.question: Is Genmo AI free to use?
faqs.answer: Yes, Genmo offers free access to its video generation capabilities through its hosted playground, with model weights available for free on GitHub and Hugging Face.

faqs.question: What is Mochi 1?
faqs.answer: Mochi 1 is Genmoâ€™s flagship open-source video generation model, featuring 10 billion parameters and the Asymmetric Diffusion Transformer architecture for realistic motion.

faqs.question: Can I use Genmo AI for commercial projects?
faqs.answer: Yes, Mochi 1 is released under the Apache 2.0 license, which permits commercial use and modification of the model.

faqs.question: What kind of videos can Genmo create?
faqs.answer: Genmo can generate a variety of videos, including cinematic trailers, social media content, and animations, based on detailed text prompts.

faqs.question: Does Genmo require technical expertise to use?
faqs.answer: The hosted playground is user-friendly for beginners, but developers with technical knowledge can customize the model using its open-source code.

faqs.question: What are the limitations of Mochi 1?
faqs.answer: The current preview of Mochi 1 is limited to 480p resolution and may produce visual artifacts in complex scenes, with higher resolutions planned for future releases.

faqs.question: How does Genmo compare to other AI video tools?
faqs.answer: Mochi 1 competes with proprietary models like Runway and Luma AI, offering comparable or superior prompt adherence and motion quality as an open-source alternative.
